author: Mina Chong
title: Editing templates for functions
question:
If we had the following data-driven template:
(define (fn-for-water g)
  (... (fn-for-lob (water-balloons g))
       (water-type g)))
Are we allowed to edit it as such:
(define (fn-for-water g)
  (make-water (fn-for-lob (water-balloons g) (water-type g))
             (water-type g)))
That is, can we call some fn-for-lob that takes 2 selectors of our data type Water as its arguments, without breaking any of our template rules? Thanks!
student_answer: As long as (fn-for-lob (water-balloons g) (water-type g)) produces the same data type as (water-balloons g), you should be able to call it without any problems!
